statement.tex: \text{Show that the function defined by }\\ f(x) = x-\left[x\right]\\ \text{is discontinuous at all integral points.}\\ \text{Here }\left[x\right] \text{denotes the greatest integer}\\ \text{less than or equal to }x.

step.context: \text{Which of the following shows correct values of }\left[x\right]?
\text{If M is an integer, then are the following} \\ \text{assertions correct?}
step.reason: \text{For an }x\geq M, \left[x\right]=M.\therefore x\to M^+\implies x-\left[x\right]\to 0.\\ \text{But for }x\lt M, \left[x\right]=M-1. \therefore x\to M^- \implies x-\left[x\right]\to 1.
